examples: The annual yield of the wheat fields surpassed expectations, resulting in a plentiful harvest.
The new CEO made her bow at the company's annual shareholder meeting.
John went great guns at the company's annual sales conference last year.
Surprisingly, the quiet neighborhood came alive with vibrant festivities during the annual festival.
If you want to succeed in Hollywood, you need to attend the annual film festival.
words.defineEn: happening or calculated yearly
words.defineVi: xảy ra hoặc tính toán hàng năm

examples: You're stuck.
We're stuck in our dark haze.
It's stuck to the bottom of my feet.
You're stuck with me.
You’re stuck with it!
words.defineEn: fixed tightly in a particular position and incapable of moving or being moved
words.defineVi: cố định chặt chẽ ở một vị trí cụ thể và không thể di chuyển hoặc bị di chuyển

examples: When their schedules didn't align, the couple made a conscious effort to make time for each other.
After learning about the benefits of unbleached flour, he made a conscious effort to incorporate it into his everyday cooking.
People are conscious about environmental impact.
Nevertheless, at the time, the case did serious damage to the Audi brand with image and safety conscious baby-boomers.
He's conscious.
words.defineEn: having awareness of one's surroundings
words.defineVi: có nhận thức về môi trường xung quanh của một người

examples: She received a missed call from an unknown phone number.
They were driven to an unknown place in the hills.
Aramide gets vulnerable and emotional as she bares her heart to an unknown lover.
I've learned to live for today for tomorrow never comes, taking risks and pursuing my dreams without fearing the unknown.
Its price is unknown.
words.defineEn: not known, identified, or familiar
words.defineVi: không được biết đến, xác định, hoặc quen thuộc

examples: The politician made his bow at the campaign rally and gave a passionate speech to the crowd.
He got on his soapbox and gave a passionate speech about income inequality.
She is a dedicated teacher who is passionate about nurturing and educating children.
Alex was offered a job opportunity, but it's not something he's passionate about.
The cut and thrust of the political debate can be intense and passionate.
words.defineEn: showing or having intense emotions or deep feelings
words.defineVi: thể hiện hoặc có cảm xúc mãnh liệt hoặc cảm xúc sâu sắc

examples: The party has broken ranks, with five of its nine presidential hopefuls calling for a review of the revisions.
Not having a prayer in the presidential election, he opted out.
Following weeks of scandals and political misfires, it has become clear that the wheels are coming off the presidential candidate's campaign.
It is expected to be a close thing in the final moments of the presidential election.
Opponents including rivals in the 2022 presidential elections accused Macron of overstepping the line with the language of his comments.
words.defineEn: involving a president or their affairs
words.defineVi: liên quan đến một tổng thống hoặc các vấn đề của họ

examples: Getting rid of noise enhances the quality of your audio and makes it sound more pleasing to the ears.
Records, cassettes, CDs, or streamed audio files.
That audio was courtesy of the pool.
The phone will record the screen without audio.
The external processor doesn't even get audio feedback.
words.defineEn: relating to recorded or broadcast sounds
words.defineVi: liên quan đến âm thanh được ghi lại hoặc phát sóng

examples: An exclusive island hideaway that takes just twenty guests.
These exclusive plants officially form the cultivar, or new apple variety.
For that, you get exclusive perks.
Abby: But even on a private island, some residents want even more exclusive perks.
And these methods aren’t necessarily mutually exclusive.
words.defineEn: limited to or available to only a specific group, individual, or category
words.defineVi: giới hạn hoặc chỉ có sẵn cho một nhóm, cá nhân hoặc danh mục cụ thể

examples: You’re just silly.
Stop inventing silly excuses.
It was a classic example of the saying 'ask a silly question and get a silly answer.'
When his friends teased him about his silly hat, he laughed along and played along with the joke.
It was a classic example of the saying 'ask a silly question and get a silly answer.'
words.defineEn: feeling embarrassed or stupid
words.defineVi: cảm thấy xấu hổ hoặc ngu ngốc

examples: As the baby grew older, we transitioned from liquid formula to a powdered formula.
In a comedy of errors, a waiter spills drinks, slips on the spilled liquid, and accidentally sends plates flying across the restaurant.
He sipped his drink, feeling the cool liquid touch his lips.
I strained the vegetable stock after simmering carrots and onions to achieve a clear liquid.
The chemical passes from a liquid to a solid state during the cooling process.
words.defineEn: flowing freely and in the form or state of a liquid
words.defineVi: chảy tự do và ở dạng hoặc trạng thái của chất lỏng

examples: So four of these carbons are neutral.
Neutral bromine has one, two, three, four, five, six, seven valence electrons.
And this entire molecules becomes neutral.
This one is also neutral for the same reason.
These were neutral.
words.defineEn: not taking any sides in a conflict, competition, or dispute and remaining impartial
words.defineVi: không đứng về phía nào trong một cuộc xung đột, cạnh tranh hoặc tranh chấp và giữ thái độ vô tư

examples: The face of the Earth was invisible.
Gases are invisible.
Older pipes, however, remain invisible.
Eventually humanity becomes basically invisible.
An individual virus particle, or virion, is invisible to our naked eye.
words.defineEn: describing something that cannot be seen
words.defineVi: mô tả một cái gì đó mà không thể được nhìn thấy

examples: Their daughter is as clever as they come.
This guy is either very clever or he's not playing with a full deck.
The clever student caught the teacher napping and managed to sneak out of class unnoticed.
In negotiations, a clever hawk hides its claws, which is why it's important to be strategic and hold back some of your bargaining chips until the right moment.
The film doesn't reinvent the wheel for action films, but it adds enough clever twists on the genre to still feel fresh and new.
words.defineEn: able to think quickly and find solutions to problems
words.defineVi: có thể suy nghĩ nhanh chóng và tìm giải pháp cho các vấn đề

examples: My sister packed some Spanish limes in her picnic basket for a tangy snack on our outdoor adventure.
She made a Spanish omelette by frying sliced potatoes and onions with beaten eggs.
In Spanish culture, it is common to greet others with a kiss on each cheek.
Flamenco is a traditional Spanish dance that is known for its expressive movements.
I love watching Spanish movies with subtitles to improve my language skills.
words.defineEn: relating to Spain or its people or language
words.defineVi: liên quan đến Tây Ban Nha hoặc con người hoặc ngôn ngữ của nó

examples: The universal language of art is bridging a divide.
People around the world enjoy various forms of music as a universal language.
After all, Death is universal.
It's universal.
Universal voting rights is a key issue in Hong Kong.
words.defineEn: concerning or influencing everyone in the world
words.defineVi: liên quan hoặc ảnh hưởng đến tất cả mọi người trên thế giới

examples: The new executive director had big plans for the organization, but it was the long-time volunteers who knew the community and its needs.
The gentlemen's agreement was never intended to apply to executive functions.
With several successful projects under her belt, she's definitely on the way to becoming a top executive.

The business executive advised her team to prioritize sleep and avoid working late into the night, stating that one hour's sleep before midnight is worth two after, emphasizing the importance of rest for productivity and decision-making.
The young executive knew that a fool shows his annoyance at once, but a prudent man overlooks an insult, so he decided to take a deep breath and respond to the feedback in a constructive way.
words.defineEn: using or having the power to decide on important matters, plans, etc.
words.defineVi: sử dụng hoặc có quyền quyết định các vấn đề quan trọng, kế hoạch, v.v.

examples: The company struggled on through some dark days several years ago, but it has since established itself as a dominant force in the market.
Stevenson used to be the dominant player on the tour, but it looks like she has finally found her match in the young newcomer.
Cash transactions are still dominant.
Definitely my left eye is dominant.
Then, around 1900, the H1-type virus became dominant.
words.defineEn: having superiority in power, influence, or importance
words.defineVi: có ưu thế về sức mạnh, ảnh hưởng, hoặc tầm quan trọng

examples: Neither side is prepared to give an inch in the negotiations.
They hosted a brunch and prepared gluten-free pancakes using a blend of gluten-free flours.
The bank was prepared to take a chance and lend him 40% of the purchase price.
I am not prepared to buy the claim that the ends justify the means.
The road bends sharply to the left just ahead, so be prepared to slow down.
words.defineEn: made ready in advance; ready and able to do or deal with something
words.defineVi: sẵn sàng trước; sẵn sàng và có thể làm hoặc đối phó với một cái gì đó

examples: The ricotta adds a creamy texture and subtle tanginess to the pancakes.
The subtle bitterness of artemisia balanced the sweetness of the dessert.
The Pinot grape juice had a subtle sweetness, making it a great base for refreshing cocktails.
Adding crème fraîche to mashed potatoes gives them a silky smooth texture and a subtle tang.
While ordinary onions have a strong pungent flavor, Welsh onions have a more delicate and subtle taste.
words.defineEn: hard to notice or detect
words.defineVi: khó nhận thấy hoặc phát hiện

examples: We label our boxes with permanent markers for easy identification.
The landscape isn’t permanent.
But these teeth are permanent!
It’s permanent.
Does it cause permanent damage?
words.defineEn: continuing to exist all the time or remaining without change for a long time
words.defineVi: tiếp tục tồn tại mọi lúc hoặc không thay đổi trong một thời gian dài

examples: After all, an electrical brain is smarter than the sum of its parts.
The repairman fixed the faulty wiring, and now the electrical system in the house was functioning as right as rain.
The old house went up in flames after a faulty electrical wiring caused a fire.
The engineer is responsible for ensuring the safety and efficiency of the electrical system.
Electrical engineers study electricity.
words.defineEn: using, producing, or operating by electricity
words.defineVi: sử dụng, sản xuất hoặc vận hành bằng điện

examples: It's going to be awkward, to say the least.
This is awkward.
This is awkward.
that was awkward.
This is awkward.
words.defineEn: making one feel embarrassed or uncomfortable
words.defineVi: làm cho một người cảm thấy xấu hổ hoặc không thoải mái

examples: A large bus was sitting outside.
The temperature outside is nineteen degrees Celsius.
The trail starts just outside the town.
The children are playing outside in the park.
Two huge fountains were playing outside the entrance.
words.defineEn: of, relating to, situated on or facing the external side or surface
words.defineVi: của, liên quan đến, nằm trên hoặc đối mặt với mặt bên ngoài hoặc bề mặt

examples: After months of chronic pain, Jake decided to go under the knife and have his knee joint replaced.
John had been putting off seeing a doctor about his chronic back pain, but finally took his wife's advice and made an appointment.
Another leading cause of memory problems is chronic stress.
Well, I have chronic pain.
Because I have chronic pain?
words.defineEn: (of an illness) difficult to cure and long-lasting
words.defineVi: (về bệnh) khó chữa và kéo dài

examples: The surgeon set her broken arm.
This broken promise is a real kick in the teeth for our fans.
He sounds like a broken record.
The X-rays show that he has a broken ankle.
He'd walk around the house repeating his favourite sayings like a broken record.
words.defineEn: cracked or shattered; physically separated into pieces
words.defineVi: nứt hoặc vỡ; vật lý tách thành từng mảnh
